Default: None

Message to send.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

channel.description:
Default: None

Channel to send the message to. If absent, the message goes to the channel selected for the I(token).

vsphere_guest.description: Create/delete/reconfigure a guest VM through VMware vSphere. This module has a dependency on pysphere >= 1.7

username.description: Username to connect to vcenter as.

resource_pool.description:
Default: None

The name of the resource_pool to create the VM in.

password.description: Password of the user to connect to vcenter as.

force.description:
Default: no

Boolean. Allows you to run commands which may alter the running state of a guest. Also used to reconfigure and destroy.

guest.description: The virtual server name you wish to manage.

vm_disk.description: A key, value list of disks and their sizes and which datastore to keep it in.

vm_hw_version.description: Desired hardware version identifier (for example, "vmx-08" for vms that needs to be managed with vSphere Client). Note that changing hardware version of existing vm is not supported.

esxi.description: Dictionary which includes datacenter and hostname on which the VM should be created. For standalone ESXi hosts, ha-datacenter should be used as the datacenter name

vm_nic.description: A key, value list of nics, their types and what network to put them on.

vm_hardware.description: A key, value list of VM config settings. Must include ['memory_mb', 'num_cpus', 'osid', 'scsi'].

from_template.description: Specifies if the VM should be deployed from a template (mutually exclusive with 'state' parameter). No guest customization changes to hardware such as CPU, RAM, NICs or Disks can be applied when launching from template.

cluster.description:
Default: None

The name of the cluster to create the VM in. By default this is derived from the host you tell the module to build the guest on.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the vm. 'reconfigured' only applies changes to 'vm_cdrom', 'memory_mb', and 'num_cpus' in vm_hardware parameter. The 'memory_mb' and 'num_cpus' changes are applied to powered-on vms when hot-plugging is enabled for the guest.

vmware_guest_facts.description: Gather facts from vCenter on a particular VM

vm_extra_config.description: A key, value pair of any extra values you want set or changed in the vmx file of the VM. Useful to set advanced options on the VM.

power_on_after_clone.description:
Default: True

Specifies if the VM should be powered on after the clone.

vcenter_hostname.description: The hostname of the vcenter server the module will connect to, to create the guest.

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

Validate SSL certs.  Note, if running on python without SSLContext support (typically, python < 2.7.9) you will have to set this to C(no) as pysphere does not support validating certificates on older python. Prior to 2.1, this module would always validate on python >= 2.7.9 and never validate on python <= 2.7.8.

template_src.description:
Default: None

Name of the source template to deploy from

snapshot_to_clone.description:
Default: none

A string that when specified, will create a linked clone copy of the VM. Snapshot must already be taken in vCenter.

pkg5_publisher.description:
IPS packages are the native packages in Solaris 11 and higher.
This modules will configure which publishers a client will download IPS packages from.

origin.description:
A path or URL to the repository.
Multiple values may be provided.

name.description: The publisher's name.

enabled.description: Is the repository enabled or disabled?

sticky.description: Packages installed from a sticky repository can only receive updates from that repository.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to ensure that a publisher is present or absent.

mirror.description:
A path or URL to the repository mirror.
Multiple values may be provided.

aos_device.description: Apstra AOS Device module let you manage your devices in AOS easily. You can approve devices and define in which state the device should be. Currently only the state I(normal) is supported but the goal is to extend this module with additional state. This module is idempotent and support the I(check) mode. It's using the AOS REST API.

name.description: The device serial-number; i.e. uniquely identifies the device in the AOS system. Only one of I(name) or I(id) can be set.

state.description:
Default: normal

Define in which state the device should be. Currently only I(normal) is supported but the goal is to add I(maint) and I(decomm).

session.description: An existing AOS session as obtained by M(aos_login) module.

location.description: When approving a device using the I(approve) argument, it's possible define the location of the device.

approve.description:
Default: no

The approve argument instruct the module to convert a device in quarantine mode into approved mode.

id.description: The AOS internal id for a device; i.e. uniquely identifies the device in the AOS system. Only one of I(name) or I(id) can be set.

avi_hardwaresecuritymodulegroup.description:
This module is used to configure HardwareSecurityModuleGroup object
more examples at U(https://github.com/avinetworks/devops)

uuid.description: Uuid of the hsm group configuration object.

url.description: Avi controller URL of the object.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type tenant.

state.description:
Default: present

The state that should be applied on the entity.

name.description: Name of the hsm group configuration object.

ce_vrf_af.description: Manages VPN instance address family of HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.

vpn_target_state.description: Manage the state of the vpn target.

vrf_aftype.description:
Default: v4

VPN instance address family.

state.description:
Default: present

Manage the state of the af.

route_distinguisher.description: VPN instance route distinguisher,the RD used to distinguish same route prefix from different vpn. The RD must be setted before setting vpn_target_value.

vrf.description: VPN instance.

evpn.description: Is extend vpn or normal vpn.

vpn_target_value.description: VPN instance target value. Such as X.X.X.X:number<0-65535> or number<0-65535>:number<0-4294967295> or number<0-65535>.number<0-65535>:number<0-65535> or number<65536-4294967295>:number<0-65535> but not support 0:0 and 0.0:0.

stackdriver.description: Send code deploy and annotation events to Stackdriver

level.description:
Default: INFO

one of INFO/WARN/ERROR, defaults to INFO if not supplied. May affect display.

annotated_by.description:
Default: Ansible

The person or robotwho the annotation should be attributed to.

deployed_by.description:
Default: Ansible

The person or robot responsible for deploying the code

deployed_to.description: The environment code was deployed to. (ie: development, staging, production)

instance_id.description: id of an EC2 instance that this event should be attached to, which will limit the contexts where this event is shown

key.description: API key.

msg.description: The contents of the annotation message, in plain text. Limited to 256 characters. Required for annotation.

event_epoch.description: Unix timestamp of where the event should appear in the timeline, defaults to now. Be careful with this.

revision_id.description: The revision of the code that was deployed. Required for deploy events

event.description: The type of event to send, either annotation or deploy

junos_static_route.description: This module provides declarative management of static IP routes on Juniper JUNOS network devices.

qualified_next_hop.description: Qualified next hop IP of the static route. Qualified next hops allow to associate preference with a particular next-hop address.

prefix.description: Network address with prefix of the static route.

admin_distance.description: Global admin preference of the static route.

active.description:
Default: True

Specifies whether or not the configuration is active or deactivated

state.description:
Default: present

State of the static route configuration.

next_hop.description: Next hop IP of the static route.

preference.description: Global admin preference of the static route.

qualified_preference.description: Assign preference for qualified next hop.

address.description: Network address with prefix of the static route.

purefa_snap.description: Create or delete volumes and volume snapshots on Pure Storage FlashArray.

name.description: The name of the source volume.

state.description:
Default: present

Define whether the volume snapshot should exist or not.

target.description: Name of target volume if creating from snapshot.

overwrite.description:
Default: no

Define whether to overwrite existing volume when creating from snapshot.

eradicate.description:
Default: no

Define whether to eradicate the snapshot on delete or leave in trash.

xattr.description: Manages filesystem user defined extended attributes, requires that they are enabled on the target filesystem and that the setfattr/getfattr utilities are present.

name.description:
Default: None

The full path of the file/object to get the facts of

value.description:
Default: None

The value to set the named name/key to, it automatically sets the C(state) to 'set'

state.description:
Default: get

defines which state you want to do. C(read) retrieves the current value for a C(key) (default) C(present) sets C(name) to C(value), default if value is set C(all) dumps all data C(keys) retrieves all keys C(absent) deletes the key

key.description:
Default: None

The name of a specific Extended attribute key to set/retrieve

path.description:
Default: None

The full path of the file/object to get the facts of

follow.description:
Default: True

if yes, dereferences symlinks and sets/gets attributes on symlink target, otherwise acts on symlink itself.

mysql_replication.description: Manages MySQL server replication, slave, master status get and change master host.

master_auto_position.description: does the host uses GTID based replication or not

mode.description:
Default: getslave

module operating mode. Could be getslave (SHOW SLAVE STATUS), getmaster (SHOW MASTER STATUS), changemaster (CHANGE MASTER TO), startslave (START SLAVE), stopslave (STOP SLAVE), resetslave (RESET SLAVE), resetslaveall (RESET SLAVE ALL)

hpilo_facts.description:
This module gathers facts for a specific system using its HP iLO interface. These facts include hardware and network related information useful for provisioning (e.g. macaddress, uuid).
This module requires the hpilo python module.

host.description: The HP iLO hostname/address that is linked to the physical system.

password.description:
Default: admin

The password to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.

ssl_version.description:
Default: TLSv1

Change the ssl_version used.

login.description:
Default: Administrator

The login name to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.

os_image.description: Add or Remove images from the OpenStack Image Repository

ramdisk.description:
Default: None

The name of an existing ramdisk image that will be associated with this image

kernel.description:
Default: None

The name of an existing kernel image that will be associated with this image

properties.description: Additional properties to be associated with this image

name.description:
Default: None

Name that has to be given to the image

container_format.description:
Default: bare

The format of the container

min_ram.description:
Default: None

The minimum ram (in MB) required to boot this image

disk_format.description:
Default: qcow2

The format of the disk that is getting uploaded

filename.description:
Default: None

The path to the file which has to be uploaded

min_disk.description:
Default: None

The minimum disk space (in GB) required to boot this image

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

owner.description:
Default: None

The owner of the image

is_public.description:
Default: yes

Whether the image can be accessed publicly. Note that publicizing an image requires admin role by default.

id.description:
Default: None

The Id of the image

ovirt_permissions.description: Module to manage permissions of users/groups in oVirt/RHV

domain.description: Authorization provider of the user/group. In previous versions of oVirt/RHV known as domain.

authz_name.description: Authorization provider of the user/group. In previous versions of oVirt/RHV known as domain.

object_type.description:
Default: vm

The object where the permissions should be managed.

namespace.description: Namespace of the authorization provider, where user/group resides.

object_name.description: Name of the object where the permissions should be managed.

object_id.description: ID of the object where the permissions should be managed.

group_name.description:
Name of the group to manage.
Note that if group don't exist in the system this module will fail, you should ensure the group exists by using M(ovirt_groups) module.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the permission be present/absent.

role.description:
Default: UserRole

Name of the role to be assigned to user/group on specific object.

user_name.description:
Username of the user to manage. In most LDAPs it's I(uid) of the user, but in Active Directory you must specify I(UPN) of the user.
Note that if user don't exist in the system this module will fail, you should ensure the user exists by using M(ovirt_users) module.

dladm_vlan.description: Create or delete VLAN interfaces on Solaris/illumos systems.

temporary.description: Specifies that the VLAN interface is temporary. Temporary VLANs do not persist across reboots.

name.description: VLAN interface name.

vid.description: VLAN ID value for VLAN interface.

state.description:
Default: present

Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.

vlan_id.description: VLAN ID value for VLAN interface.

name.description: Name of the plugin to install. In Eleasticsearch >= 2.0, the name can be an URL or file location.

proxy_host.description:
Default: None

Proxy host to use during plugin installation

url.description:
Default: None

Set exact URL to download the plugin from (Only works for ES 1.x)

proxy_port.description:
Default: None

Proxy port to use during plugin installation

state.description:
Default: present

Desired state of a plugin.

version.description:
Default: None

Version of the plugin to be installed. If plugin exists with previous version, it will NOT be updated

timeout.description:
Default: 1m

Timeout setting: 30s, 1m, 1h...
Only valid for Elasticsearch < 5.0. This option is ignored for Elasticsearch > 5.0.

plugin_dir.description:
Default: /usr/share/elasticsearch/plugins/

Your configured plugin directory specified in Elasticsearch

plugin_bin.description:
Default: None

Location of the plugin binary. If this file is not found, the default plugin binaries will be used.
The default changed in Ansible 2.4 to None.

proxysql_mysql_users.description: The M(proxysql_mysql_users) module adds or removes mysql users using the proxysql admin interface.

username.description: Name of the user connecting to the mysqld or ProxySQL instance.

default_hostgroup.description: If there is no matching rule for the queries sent by this user, the traffic it generates is sent to the specified hostgroup. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is 0.

frontend.description:
Default: True

If I(frontend) is set to C(True), this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the mysqld servers against any hostgroup.

default_schema.description: The schema to which the connection should change to by default.

transaction_persistent.description: If this is set for the user with which the MySQL client is connecting to ProxySQL (thus a "frontend" user), transactions started within a hostgroup will remain within that hostgroup regardless of any other rules. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(transaction_persistent) is C(False).

login_port.description:
Default: 6032

The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

login_user.description:
Default: None

The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

login_host.description:
Default: 127.0.0.1

The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

login_password.description:
Default: None

The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

use_ssl.description: If I(use_ssl) is set to C(True), connections by this user will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is C(False).

backend.description:
Default: True

If I(backend) is set to C(True), this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the ProxySQL instance.

state.description:
Default: present

When C(present) - adds the user, when C(absent) - removes the user.

fast_forward.description: If I(fast_forward) is set to C(True), I(fast_forward) will bypass the query processing layer (rewriting, caching) and pass through the query directly as is to the backend server. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(fast_forward) is C(False).

load_to_runtime.description:
Default: True

Dynamically load mysql host config to runtime memory.

save_to_disk.description:
Default: True

Save mysql host config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.

active.description: A user with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(active) is C(True).

config_file.description: Specify a config file from which login_user and login_password are to be read.

password.description: Password of the user connecting to the mysqld or ProxySQL instance.

max_connections.description: The maximum number of connections ProxySQL will open to the backend for this user. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_connections) is 10000.

ops_config.description: OpenSwitch configurations use a simple block indent file syntax for segmenting configuration into sections.  This module provides an implementation for working with ops configuration sections in a deterministic way.

src.description: The I(src) argument provides a path to the configuration file to load into the remote system.  The path can either be a full system path to the configuration file if the value starts with / or relative to the root of the implemented role or playbook. This argument is mutually exclusive with the I(lines) and I(parents) arguments.

force.description:
The force argument instructs the module to not consider the current devices running-config.  When set to true, this will cause the module to push the contents of I(src) into the device without first checking if already configured.
Note this argument should be considered deprecated.  To achieve the equivalent, set the C(match=none) which is idempotent.  This argument will be removed in a future release.

after.description: The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

lines.description: The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.

replace.description:
Default: line

Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

parents.description: The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

save.description: The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running- config to the startup-config at the conclusion of the module running.  If check mode is specified, this argument is ignored.

config.description: The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current running-config to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current running-config for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuration to use as the base config for comparison.

match.description:
Default: line

Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  If match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if match is set to I(none), the module will not attempt to compare the source configuration with the running configuration on the remote device.

before.description: The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

vyos_config.description: This module provides configuration file management of VyOS devices.  It provides arguments for managing both the configuration file and state of the active configuration.   All configuration statements are based on `set` and `delete` commands in the device configuration.

comment.description:
Default: configured by vyos_config

Allows a commit description to be specified to be included when the configuration is committed.  If the configuration is not changed or committed, this argument is ignored.

src.description: The C(src) argument specifies the path to the source config file to load.  The source config file can either be in bracket format or set format.  The source file can include Jinja2 template variables.

config.description: The C(config) argument specifies the base configuration to use to compare against the desired configuration.  If this value is not specified, the module will automatically retrieve the current active configuration from the remote device.

lines.description: The ordered set of configuration lines to be managed and compared with the existing configuration on the remote device.

save.description: The C(save) argument controls whether or not changes made to the active configuration are saved to disk.  This is independent of committing the config.  When set to True, the active configuration is saved.

backup.description: The C(backup) argument will backup the current devices active configuration to the Ansible control host prior to making any changes.  The backup file will be located in the backup folder in the root of the playbook

match.description:
Default: line

The C(match) argument controls the method used to match against the current active configuration.  By default, the desired config is matched against the active config and the deltas are loaded.  If the C(match) argument is set to C(none) the active configuration is ignored and the configuration is always loaded.

os_project.description: Manage OpenStack Projects. Projects can be created, updated or deleted using this module. A project will be updated if I(name) matches an existing project and I(state) is present. The value for I(name) cannot be updated without deleting and re-creating the project.

domain.description:
Default: None

Domain id to create the project in if the cloud supports domains. The domain_id parameter requires shade >= 1.8.0

name.description: Name for the project

enabled.description:
Default: True

Is the project enabled

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

domain_id.description:
Default: None

Domain id to create the project in if the cloud supports domains. The domain_id parameter requires shade >= 1.8.0

description.description:
Default: None

Description for the project

bigip_device_sshd.description: Manage the SSHD settings of a BIG-IP

log_level.description: Specifies the minimum SSHD message level to include in the system log.

banner_text.description: Specifies the text to include on the pre-login banner that displays when a user attempts to login to the system using SSH.

allow.description: Specifies, if you have enabled SSH access, the IP address or address range for other systems that can use SSH to communicate with this system.

inactivity_timeout.description: Specifies the number of seconds before inactivity causes an SSH session to log out.

login.description: Specifies, when checked C(enabled), that the system accepts SSH communications.

banner.description: Whether to enable the banner or not.

port.description: Port that you want the SSH daemon to run on.

zfs.description: Manages ZFS file systems, volumes, clones and snapshots.

origin.description: Snapshot from which to create a clone

state.description: Whether to create (C(present)), or remove (C(absent)) a file system, snapshot or volume. All parents/children will be created/destroyed as needed to reach the desired state.

name.description: File system, snapshot or volume name e.g. C(rpool/myfs)

key_value.description: The C(zfs) module takes key=value pairs for zfs properties to be set. See the zfs(8) man page for more information.

uri.description: Interacts with HTTP and HTTPS web services and supports Digest, Basic and WSSE HTTP authentication mechanisms.

body.description: The body of the http request/response to the web service. If C(body_format) is set to 'json' it will take an already formatted JSON string or convert a data structure into JSON.

status_code.description:
Default: 200

A valid, numeric, HTTP status code that signifies success of the request. Can also be comma separated list of status codes.

headers.description: Add custom HTTP headers to a request in the format of a YAML hash

dest.description: path of where to download the file to (if desired). If I(dest) is a directory, the basename of the file on the remote server will be used.

follow_redirects.description:
Default: safe

Whether or not the URI module should follow redirects. C(all) will follow all redirects. C(safe) will follow only "safe" redirects, where "safe" means that the client is only doing a GET or HEAD on the URI to which it is being redirected. C(none) will not follow any redirects. Note that C(yes) and C(no) choices are accepted for backwards compatibility, where C(yes) is the equivalent of C(all) and C(no) is the equivalent of C(safe). C(yes) and C(no) are deprecated and will be removed in some future version of Ansible.

force_basic_auth.description:
Default: no

The library used by the uri module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.

removes.description: a filename, when it does not exist, this step will not be run.

method.description:
Default: GET

The HTTP method of the request or response. It MUST be uppercase.

creates.description: a filename, when it already exists, this step will not be run.

url.description: HTTP or HTTPS URL in the form (http|https)://host.domain[:port]/path

user.description: username for the module to use for Digest, Basic or WSSE authentication.

timeout.description:
Default: 30

The socket level timeout in seconds

others.description: all arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here

body_format.description:
Default: raw

The serialization format of the body. When set to json, encodes the body argument, if needed, and automatically sets the Content-Type header accordingly.

return_content.description:
Default: no

Whether or not to return the body of the request as a "content" key in the dictionary result. If the reported Content-type is "application/json", then the JSON is additionally loaded into a key called C(json) in the dictionary results.

password.description: password for the module to use for Digest, Basic or WSSE authentication.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.  Prior to 1.9.2 the code defaulted to C(no).

HEADER_.description: Any parameter starting with "HEADER_" is a sent with your request as a header. For example, HEADER_Content-Type="application/json" would send the header "Content-Type" along with your request with a value of "application/json". This option is deprecated as of C(2.1) and may be removed in a future release. Use I(headers) instead.

ce_facts.description: Collects facts from CloudEngine devices running the CloudEngine operating system.  Fact collection is supported over Cli transport.  This module prepends all of the base network fact keys with C(ansible_net_<fact>).  The facts module will always collect a base set of facts from the device and can enable or disable collection of additional facts.

gather_subset.description:
Default: !config

When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.

gce_snapshot.description: Manages snapshots for GCE instances. This module manages snapshots for the storage volumes of a GCE compute instance. If there are multiple volumes, each snapshot will be prepended with the disk name

service_account_email.description: GCP service account email for the project where the instance resides

disks.description:
Default: all

A list of disks to create snapshots for. If none is provided, all of the volumes will be snapshotted

state.description:
Default: present

Whether a snapshot should be C(present) or C(absent)

snapshot_name.description: The name of the snapshot to manage

credentials_file.description: The path to the credentials file associated with the service account

project_id.description: The GCP project ID to use

ce_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.

addr.description: Specifies the address of the network segment where the interface resides. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

area.description: Specifies the area ID. The area with the area-id being 0 is a backbone area. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "0.0.0.0") or as an integer between 1 and 4294967295.

max_load_balance.description: The maximum number of paths for forward packets over multiple paths. Valid value is an integer in the range from 1 to 64.

mask.description: IP network wildcard bits in decimal format between 0 and 32.

auth_key_id.description: Authentication key id when C(auth_mode) is 'hmac-sha256', 'md5' or 'hmac-md5. Valid value is an integer is in the range from 1 to 255.

auth_text_simple.description: Specifies a password for simple authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 8 characters.

state.description:
Default: present

Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

process_id.description: Specifies a process ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

nexthop_addr.description: IPv4 address for configure next-hop address's weight. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address.

auth_text_md5.description: Specifies a password for MD5, HMAC-MD5, or HMAC-SHA256 authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

nexthop_weight.description: Indicates the weight of the next hop. The smaller the value is, the higher the preference of the route is. It is an integer that ranges from 1 to 254.

win_route.description: Add or remove a static route.

metric.description:
Default: 1

Metric used by the static route.

destination.description: Destination IP address in CIDR format (ip address/prefix length)

gateway.description:
The gateway used by the static route.
If C(gateway) is not provided it will be set to C(0.0.0.0).

state.description:
Default: present

If present, it adds a network static route. If absent, it removes a network static route.

nginx_status_facts.description: Gathers facts from nginx from an URL having C(stub_status) enabled.

url.description: URL of the nginx status.

timeout.description:
Default: 10

HTTP connection timeout in seconds.

java_cert.description: This is a wrapper module around keytool. Which can be used to import/remove certificates from a given java keystore.

keystore_create.description: Create keystore if it doesn't exist

executable.description:
Default: keytool

Path to keytool binary if not used we search in PATH for it.

pkcs12_alias.description:
Default: 1

Alias in the PKCS12 keystore.

cert_port.description:
Default: 443

Port to connect to URL. This will be used to create server URL:PORT

pkcs12_password.description: Password for importing from PKCS12 keystore.

state.description:
Default: present

Defines action which can be either certificate import or removal.

cert_path.description: Local path to load certificate from. One of cert_url or cert_path is required to load certificate.

cert_url.description: Basic URL to fetch SSL certificate from. One of cert_url or cert_path is required to load certificate.

pkcs12_path.description: Local path to load PKCS12 keystore from.

blockinfile.description: This module will insert/update/remove a block of multi-line text surrounded by customizable marker lines.

name.description:
The file to modify.
Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

insertbefore.description:
Default: None

If specified, the block will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the block at the beginning of the file.  If specified regular expression has no matches, the block will be inserted at the end of the file.

dest.description:
The file to modify.
Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

create.description:
Default: no

Create a new file if it doesn't exist.

destfile.description:
The file to modify.
Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

content.description: The text to insert inside the marker lines. If it's missing or an empty string, the block will be removed as if C(state) were specified to C(absent).

insertafter.description:
Default: EOF

If specified, the block will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the block at the end of the file.  If specified regular expression has no matches, C(EOF) will be used instead.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the block should be there or not.

follow.description:
Default: no

This flag indicates that filesystem links, if they exist, should be followed.

marker.description:
Default: # {mark} ANSIBLE MANAGED BLOCK

The marker line template. "{mark}" will be replaced with "BEGIN" or "END".

path.description:
The file to modify.
Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

backup.description:
Default: no

Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

block.description: The text to insert inside the marker lines. If it's missing or an empty string, the block will be removed as if C(state) were specified to C(absent).

pause.description:
Pauses playbook execution for a set amount of time, or until a prompt is acknowledged. All parameters are optional. The default behavior is to pause with a prompt.
You can use C(ctrl+c) if you wish to advance a pause earlier than it is set to expire or if you need to abort a playbook run entirely. To continue early: press C(ctrl+c) and then C(c). To abort a playbook: press C(ctrl+c) and then C(a).
The pause module integrates into async/parallelized playbooks without any special considerations (see also: Rolling Updates). When using pauses with the C(serial) playbook parameter (as in rolling updates) you are only prompted once for the current group of hosts.

seconds.description: A positive number of seconds to pause for.

prompt.description: Optional text to use for the prompt message.

minutes.description: A positive number of minutes to pause for.

nxos_template.description: Manages network device configurations over SSH or NXAPI.  This module allows implementers to work with the device running-config.  It provides a way to push a set of commands onto a network device by evaluating the current running-config and only pushing configuration commands that are not already configured.  The config source can be a set of commands or a template.

src.description: The path to the config source.  The source can be either a file with config or a template that will be merged during runtime.  By default the task will search for the source file in role or playbook root folder in templates directory.

config.description: The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current running-config to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current running-config for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuration to use as the base config for comparison.

force.description: The force argument instructs the module to not consider the current devices running-config.  When set to true, this will cause the module to push the contents of I(src) into the device without first checking if already configured.

backup.description: When this argument is configured true, the module will backup the running-config from the node prior to making any changes. The backup file will be written to backup_{{ hostname }} in the root of the playbook directory.

include_defaults.description: The module, by default, will collect the current device running-config to use as a base for comparisons to the commands in I(src).  Setting this value to true will cause the module to issue the command C(show running-config all) to include all device settings.

ipa_group.description: Add, modify and delete group within IPA server

group.description:
List of group names assigned to this group.
If an empty list is passed all groups will be removed from this group.
If option is omitted assigned groups will not be checked or changed.
Groups that are already assigned but not passed will be removed.

cn.description:
Canonical name.
Can not be changed as it is the unique identifier.

user.description:
List of user names assigned to this group.
If an empty list is passed all users will be removed from this group.
If option is omitted assigned users will not be checked or changed.
Users that are already assigned but not passed will be removed.

ipa_prot.description:
Default: https

Protocol used by IPA server

state.description:
Default: present

State to ensure

gidnumber.description: GID (use this option to set it manually).

ipa_host.description:
Default: ipa.example.com

IP or hostname of IPA server

external.description: Allow adding external non-IPA members from trusted domains.

ipa_user.description:
Default: admin

Administrative account used on IPA server

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

This only applies if C(ipa_prot) is I(https).
If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

name.description:
Canonical name.
Can not be changed as it is the unique identifier.

panos_lic.description:
Apply an authcode to a device.
The authcode should have been previously registered on the Palo Alto Networks support portal.
The device should have Internet access.

username.description:
Default: admin

username for authentication

force.description:
Default: false

whether to apply authcode even if device is already licensed

password.description: password for authentication

ip_address.description: IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device

ce_vxlan_tunnel.description: This module offers the ability to set the VNI and mapped to the BD, and configure an ingress replication list on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.

vni_id.description: Specifies a VXLAN network identifier (VNI) ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16000000.

nve_mode.description: Specifies the working mode of an NVE interface.

source_ip.description: Specifies an IP address for a source VTEP. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

bridge_domain_id.description: Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

peer_list_ip.description: Specifies the IP address of a remote VXLAN tunnel endpoints (VTEP). The value is in dotted decimal notation.

state.description:
Default: present

Manage the state of the resource.

nve_name.description: Specifies the number of an NVE interface. The value ranges from 1 to 2.

protocol_type.description: The operation type of routing protocol.

nxos_pim_rp_address.description: Manages configuration of an Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) static rendezvous point (RP) address instance.

route_map.description: Route map policy for static RP. Valid values are route-map policy names.

prefix_list.description: Prefix list policy for static RP. Valid values are prefix-list policy names.

rp_address.description: Configures a Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) static rendezvous point (RP) address. Valid values are unicast addresses.

group_list.description: Group range for static RP. Valid values are multicast addresses.

bidir.description: Group range is treated in PIM bidirectional mode.

cnos_template.description: This module allows you to work with the running configuration of a switch. It provides a way to execute a set of CNOS commands on a switch by evaluating the current running configuration and executing the commands only if the specific settings have not been already configured. The configuration source can be a set of commands or a template written in the Jinja2 templating language. This module uses SSH to manage network device configuration. The results of the operation will be placed in a directory named 'results' that must be created by the user in their local directory to where the playbook is run. For more information about this module from Lenovo and customizing it usage for your use cases, please visit U(http://systemx.lenovofiles.com/help/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.lenovo.switchmgt.ansible.doc%2Fcnos_template.html)

commandfile.description: This specifies the path to the CNOS command file which needs to be applied. This usually comes from the commands folder. Generally this file is the output of the variables applied on a template file. So this command is preceded by a template module. Note The command file must contain the Ansible keyword {{ inventory_hostname }} in its filename to ensure that the command file is unique for each switch and condition. If this is omitted, the command file will be overwritten during iteration. For example, commandfile=./commands/clos_leaf_bgp_{{ inventory_hostname }}_commands.txt

pulp_repo.description: Add or remove Pulp repos from a remote host.

feed.description: Upstream feed URL to receive updates from.

url_password.description: The password for use in HTTP basic authentication to the pulp API. If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

repo_type.description:
Default: rpm

Repo plugin type to use (i.e. C(rpm), C(docker)).

pulp_host.description:
Default: http://127.0.0.1

URL of the pulp server to connect to.

publish_distributor.description: Distributor to use when state is C(publish). The default is to publish all distributors.

name.description: Name of the repo to add or remove. This correlates to repo-id in Pulp.

relative_url.description: Relative URL for the local repository.

proxy_host.description: Proxy url setting for the pulp repository importer. This is in the format scheme://host.

force_basic_auth.description:
Default: no

httplib2, the library used by the M(uri) module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.

importer_ssl_client_key.description: Private key to the certificate specified in I(importer_ssl_client_cert), assuming it is not included in the certificate file itself. This can be the file content or the path to the file.

importer_ssl_client_cert.description: Certificate used as the client certificate when synchronizing the repository. This is used to communicate authentication information to the feed source. The value to this option must be the full path to the certificate. The specified file may be the certificate itself or a single file containing both the certificate and private key. This can be the file content or the path to the file.

proxy_port.description: Proxy port setting for the pulp repository importer.

state.description:
Default: present

The repo state. A state of C(sync) will queue a sync of the repo. This is asynchronous but not delayed like a scheduled sync. A state of C(publish) will use the repository's distributor to publish the content.

serve_https.description:
Default: True

Make the repo available over HTTPS.

serve_http.description: Make the repo available over HTTP.

url_username.description: The username for use in HTTP basic authentication to the pulp API.

wait_for_completion.description:
Default: no

Wait for asynchronous tasks to complete before returning.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

add_export_distributor.description: Whether or not to add the export distributor to new C(rpm) repositories.

importer_ssl_ca_cert.description: CA certificate string used to validate the feed source SSL certificate. This can be the file content or the path to the file.

twilio.description: Sends a text message to a phone number through the Twilio messaging API.

to_number.description: one or more phone numbers to send the text message to, format +15551112222

account_sid.description: user's Twilio account token found on the account page

from_number.description: the Twilio number to send the text message from, format +15551112222

msg.description: the body of the text message

media_url.description: a URL with a picture, video or sound clip to send with an MMS (multimedia message) instead of a plain SMS

ce_stp.description: Manages STP configurations on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.

tc_protection_interval.description: Set the time the MSTP device takes to handle the maximum number of TC BPDUs and immediately refresh forwarding entries. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 600, in seconds.

loop_protection.description: Enable loop protection on the current port.

tc_protection_threshold.description: Set the maximum number of TC BPDUs that the MSTP can handle. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255. The default value is 1 on the switch.

stp_converge.description: STP convergence mode. Fast means set STP aging mode to Fast. Normal means set STP aging mode to Normal.

stp_mode.description: Set an operation mode for the current MSTP process. The mode can be STP, RSTP, or MSTP.

bpdu_protection.description: Configure BPDU protection on an edge port. This function prevents network flapping caused by attack packets.

root_protection.description: Enable root protection on the current port.

state.description:
Default: present

Specify desired state of the resource.

bpdu_filter.description: Specify a port as a BPDU filter port.

stp_enable.description: Enable or disable STP on a switch.

interface.description: Interface name. If the value is C(all), will apply configuration to all interfaces. if the value is a special name, only support input the full name.

tc_protection.description: Configure the TC BPDU protection function for an MSTP process.

edged_port.description: Set the current port as an edge port.

cost.description: Set the path cost of the current port. The default instance is 0.

os_server_action.description: Perform server actions on an existing compute instance from OpenStack. This module does not return any data other than changed true/false. When I(action) is 'rebuild', then I(image) parameter is required.

image.description: Image the server should be rebuilt with

server.description: Name or ID of the instance

timeout.description:
Default: 180

The amount of time the module should wait for the instance to perform the requested action.

action.description:
Default: present

Perform the given action. The lock and unlock actions always return changed as the servers API does not provide lock status.

wait.description:
Default: yes

If the module should wait for the instance action to be performed.

pagerduty.description: This module will let you create PagerDuty maintenance windows

name.description: PagerDuty unique subdomain.

service.description: A comma separated list of PagerDuty service IDs.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

token.description: A pagerduty token, generated on the pagerduty site. Can be used instead of user/passwd combination.

hours.description:
Default: 1

Length of maintenance window in hours.

state.description: Create a maintenance window or get a list of ongoing windows.

user.description: PagerDuty user ID.

services.description: A comma separated list of PagerDuty service IDs.

requester_id.description: ID of user making the request. Only needed when using a token and creating a maintenance_window.

minutes.description: Maintenance window in minutes (this is added to the hours).

desc.description:
Default: Created by Ansible

Short description of maintenance window.

pkgng.description: Manage binary packages for FreeBSD using 'pkgng' which is available in versions after 9.0.

chroot.description:
Pkg will chroot in the specified environment.
Can not be used together with I(rootdir) or I(jail) options.

name.description: Name of package to install/remove.

cached.description: Use local package base instead of fetching an updated one.

pkgsite.description:
For pkgng versions before 1.1.4, specify packagesite to use for downloading packages. If not specified, use settings from C(/usr/local/etc/pkg.conf).
For newer pkgng versions, specify a the name of a repository configured in C(/usr/local/etc/pkg/repos).

rootdir.description:
For pkgng versions 1.5 and later, pkg will install all packages within the specified root directory.

annotation.description: A comma-separated list of keyvalue-pairs of the form C(<+/-/:><key>[=<value>]). A C(+) denotes adding an annotation, a C(-) denotes removing an annotation, and C(:) denotes modifying an annotation. If setting or modifying annotations, a value must be provided.

letsencrypt.description:
Create and renew SSL certificates with Let's Encrypt. Let's Encrypt is a free, automated, and open certificate authority (CA), run for the public's benefit. For details see U(https://letsencrypt.org). The current implementation supports the http-01, tls-sni-02 and dns-01 challenges.
To use this module, it has to be executed at least twice. Either as two different tasks in the same run or during multiple runs.
Between these two tasks you have to fulfill the required steps for the chosen challenge by whatever means necessary. For http-01 that means creating the necessary challenge file on the destination webserver. For dns-01 the necessary dns record has to be created. tls-sni-02 requires you to create a SSL certificate with the appropriate subjectAlternativeNames. It is I(not) the responsibility of this module to perform these steps.
For details on how to fulfill these challenges, you might have to read through U(https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-acme-acme-02#section-7)
Although the defaults are chosen so that the module can be used with the Let's Encrypt CA, the module can be used with any service using the ACME protocol.

acme_directory.description:
Default: https://acme-staging.api.letsencrypt.org/directory

The ACME directory to use. This is the entry point URL to access CA server API.
For safety reasons the default is set to the Let's Encrypt staging server. This will create technically correct, but untrusted certificates.

src.description:
File containing the CSR for the new certificate.
Can be created with C(openssl csr ...).
The CSR may contain multiple Subject Alternate Names, but each one will lead to an individual challenge that must be fulfilled for the CSR to be signed.

account_email.description:
The email address associated with this account.
It will be used for certificate expiration warnings.

dest.description: The destination file for the certificate.

remaining_days.description:
Default: 10

The number of days the certificate must have left being valid. If C(cert_days < remaining_days), then it will be renewed. If the certificate is not renewed, module return values will not include C(challenge_data).

challenge.description:
Default: http-01

The challenge to be performed.

agreement.description:
Default: https://letsencrypt.org/documents/LE-SA-v1.1.1-August-1-2016.pdf

URI to a terms of service document you agree to when using the ACME service at C(acme_directory).

account_key.description:
File containing the Let's Encrypt account RSA key.
Can be created with C(openssl rsa ...).

cert.description: The destination file for the certificate.

data.description:
The data to validate ongoing challenges.
The value that must be used here will be provided by a previous use of this module.

csr.description:
File containing the CSR for the new certificate.
Can be created with C(openssl csr ...).
The CSR may contain multiple Subject Alternate Names, but each one will lead to an individual challenge that must be fulfilled for the CSR to be signed.

win_wait_for.description:
You can wait for a set amount of time C(timeout), this is the default if nothing is specified.
Waiting for a port to become available is useful for when services are not immediately available after their init scripts return which is true of certain Java application servers.
You can wait for a file to exist or not exist on the filesystem.
This module can also be used to wait for a regex match string to be present in a file.
You can wait for active connections to be closed before continuing on a local port.

state.description:
Default: started

When checking a port, C(started) will ensure the port is open, C(stopped) will check that is it closed and C(drained) will check for active connections.
When checking for a file or a search string C(present) or C(started) will ensure that the file or string is present, C(absent) will check that the file or search string is absent or removed.

connect_timeout.description:
Default: 5

The maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.

delay.description: The number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.

host.description:
Default: 127.0.0.1

A resolvable hostname or IP address to wait for.
If C(state=drained) then it will only check for connections on the IP specified, you can use '0.0.0.0' to use all host IPs.

sleep.description:
Default: 1

Number of seconds to sleep between checks.

timeout.description:
Default: 300

The maximum number of seconds to wait for.

exclude_hosts.description: The list of hosts or IPs to ignore when looking for active TCP connections when C(state=drained).

search_regex.description:
Can be used to match a string in a file.
If C(state) is present or started then it will wait until the regex matches.
If C(state) is absent then it will wait until the regex does not match.
Defaults to a multiline regex.

path.description:
The path to a file on the filesystem to check.
If C(state) is present or started then it will wait until the file exists.
If C(state) is absent then it will wait until the file does not exist.

port.description: The port number to poll on C(host).

name.description: The name of the user to manage.

authentication_method.description:
Authentication method for the application.
Not all authentication methods are valid for an application.
Valid authentication methods for each application are as denoted in I(authentication_choices_description).
password for console application
password, domain, nsswitch, cert for http application.
password, domain, nsswitch, cert for ontapi application.
community for snmp application (when creating SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 users).
usm and community for snmp application (when creating SNMPv3 users).
password for sp application.
password for rsh application.
password for telnet application.
password, publickey, domain, nsswitch for ssh application.

C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

password_never_expires.description: C(yes) will set the password to never expire.  C(no) will allow the password to expire.

groups_action.description:
Default: replace

If C(replace), the user is added as a member of each group in I(groups) and removed from any other groups.  If C(add), the user is added to each group in I(groups) where not already a member.  If C(remove), the user is removed from each group in I(groups).

password_expired.description: C(yes) will require the user to change their password at next login. C(no) will clear the expired password flag.

state.description:
Default: present

When C(present), creates or updates the user account.  When C(absent), removes the user account if it exists.  When C(query) (new in 1.9), retrieves the user account details without making any changes.

groups.description: Adds or removes the user from this comma-separated lis of groups, depending on the value of I(groups_action). When I(groups_action) is C(replace) and I(groups) is set to the empty string ('groups='), the user is removed from all groups.

account_disabled.description: C(yes) will disable the user account.  C(no) will clear the disabled flag.

password.description: Optionally set the user's password to this (plain text) value.

account_locked.description: C(no) will unlock the user account if locked.

user_cannot_change_password.description: C(yes) will prevent the user from changing their password.  C(no) will allow the user to change their password.

description.description: Description of the user

ops_command.description: Sends arbitrary commands to an OpenSwitch node and returns the results read from the device. This module includes an argument that will cause the module to wait for a specific condition before returning or timing out if the condition is not met.

retries.description:
Default: 10

Specifies the number of retries a command should by tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditions.

commands.description: List of commands to send to the remote ops device over the configured provider. The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retires as expired.

waitfor.description: List of conditions to evaluate against the output of the command. The task will wait for each condition to be true before moving forward. If the conditional is not true within the configured number of retries, the task fails. See examples.

interval.description:
Default: 1

Configures the interval in seconds to wait between I(retries) of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditions, the interval indicates how long to wait before trying the command again.

wait_for.description: List of conditions to evaluate against the output of the command. The task will wait for each condition to be true before moving forward. If the conditional is not true within the configured number of retries, the task fails. See examples.

match.description:
Default: all

The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy.  Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the I(wait_for) must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

For Windows targets, use the M(win_tempfile) module instead.
